wiki_description:
The man who saw potential in Garrett and recruited him into the Order of the Keepers, back when Garrett was living as a street urchin.

A mentor (of sorts) to Garrett and one of the very few people Garrett truly respects (and also, probably the only person out there who's as good as Garrett, in regards to stealth, if not better than him, even).

related_topics.description:
The player character of the Thief series and an absolute master at what he does.

Garrett started out as a street urchin, begging for alms and pickpocketing. One night, he tried to steal a purse from a man but got caught in the act. The man was impressed with his sneaking skills and offered him a place in a secret organization  he was a member of by the name of 'The Keepers'.

Years later, after being trained in their ways, Garrett gets fed up with their ideology and leaves them to pursue a life of thievery.

'The Trickster' was a name given by the Order of the Hammer, who believe that his mere existence goes against the very teachings of their order, thus branding him as a satanic/devilish figure, who "tricks" manfolk and thus, is their mortal, arch-enemy.

The Trickster goes by many names - the Woodsie Lord, the Honeymaker, the Jacksberry, among many others.

He is the supreme deity for the Pagans.

The Pagans worship him on the basis that he is the creator of all living species, including manfolk and that he wishes them to live in harmony and tranquility with the nature and chaos all around them.

The arrival of the Builder, the foundation of civilization and the technological progress made by the Hammerite Order over centuries, going at odds with the nature and wildlife around them and removing the natural chaos in the process, is what enraged the Trickster, making him resort to framing 'The Dark Project', where he intended on ending civilization and restore back the lost chaos.

The Builder is the supereme, messianic personality worshipped by the Order of the Hammer (Hammerities).

Outside of Hammerite scriptures, not much information or background exists about the Builder. Even whether or not he actually existed remains a mystery.

The Hammerites believe that the Builder was the one who taught mankfolk the art and craftsmanship of building. They also believe in the way of the hammer - that it is the divine duty of the manfolk to build things, improve technology so as to bring order and stability inorder to tame and eliminate the chaos and anarchy that surrounds them all around.

Thus, it can be inferred that the Builder laid the foundation of civilization, making manfolk move away from a nomadic life of hunting and foraging to a sedantary life of agriculture and industries.

Brother Karras used to be an exemplary, high-ranking member of the Hammerite Order. 

However, he had a speech impediment that was the subject of mockery and ridicule from others.

After the Trickster initiated the Dark Project and almost brought civilization to its end, he felt that the order wasn't following the Builder's teachings like the way they were meant to, not being rigorous and devoted enough.

And so, he breaks away from the order and creates a parallel, splinter religion which too, follows the Builder's core teachings albeit, with some revised interpretations and additions.

That order went by the name of 'The Mechanist Order', with Karras being its highest ranking member, being addressed by his devotees as 'Father Karras'.

The order pushed the City into a technological revolution, with new, powerful and efficient inventions improving its infrastructure, thus, bringing the attention and patronage of the City's aristocrats and law enforcement.

The newly-appointed Sheriff of the the City Watch.

Extremely efficient, relentless and strict with his dealings of law and order. 

Also modernised and re-invented the City Watch into a more professional, highly-organized institution.

Despite all this, not everything is what meets the eye about this Sheriff, as he seemingly has a personal vendetta towards Garrett (all the while, having made the Master Thief's life and operation harder than it already was, due to his reforms).
One of the very few people out there that Garrett remotely considers to be as his "friend" (of sorts).
An associate of Garrett, who served as his fence and informer.
A member of the Hammerite Order and a childhood friend of Lauryl, who met as orphans, during their stay at Shalebridge Cradle.

The man who saw potential in Garrett and recruited him into the Order of the Keepers, back when Garrett was living as a street urchin.

A mentor (of sorts) to Garrett and one of the very few people Garrett truly respects (and also, probably the only person out there who's as good as Garrett, in regards to stealth, if not better than him, even).
